text: I was looking to get out of the apartment on a really nice, sunny day and we decided to drive to Waterfront and walk around. All around great day until we hit Bar Louie for some drinks and appetizers. I am giving it one star, though it deserves none, because our waitress was nice, if a bit inattentive, and the hummus app we ordered was pretty damn good. Outside of that Bar Louie leaves a lot to be desired. This is probably the first place I've been to where they charge $10 and up for all mixed drinks. To me, that is beyond ridiculous. Bar Louie is not an upscale restaurant, as much as they wish they were, and paying almost $60 for three drinks and two appetizers is insanity defined. As I mentioned the waitress was friendly, but she definitely did not come back and check on us enough. I really wanted to like this place because of things I had heard and the drinks we had were really damn good, but if it want to spend that kind of money, I'll go somewhere that I can get good service.

The prices were outrageous for the quality of food and drinks we received. I would not recommend Bar Louie to anyone.

The sandwich I ordered was bland and uninspiring, lacking any distinct flavors. It was a disappointing contrast to the delicious hummus we had enjoyed earlier at Bar Louie. Moreover, the prices at this cafe were exorbitant, with even a simple cup of coffee costing an arm and a leg. Overall, I would give this cafe a rating of one star, solely for its pleasant atmosphere and nothing more.

text: I was quoted a price for a new pair of glasses and lenses that were in the 50% area. Came back the next day excited to buy the glasses and was told the glasses were not on sale for 50% and that the quote someone gave me the day before was wrong. The new quote was DOUBLE what I was quoted the day before! Not only was I disappointed about the price, but the sale associate was rude and didn't care about what had happened. I will never shop at Lens Crafters ever again. What a horrible experience! I also came in many times before and the employees never helped me. They were just sitting down doing nothing. I honestly don't know how they are able to stay in business if they don't help customers or at least ask.

text: Awful place. If you are trying to go there for good drinks this is an OK place to go to but the food was horrible. The tapas ceviche was $10 which came with 4 shrimp and was topped with popcorn (I have no idea why). If they were trying to go for fun and innovative food this place completely missed the mark. The potatoes and chorizo came in an extremely small portions and where bland. Not to mention the paella which was $25 and the rice was not well cooked. This place takes small portions to a new level. Overall I left that place with $80 less and still hungry. Not worth the money and the food was a complete disappointment. The only reason this place is getting two stars is because of their drinks.

text: I called and orders three sandwich platters and a veggie platter for pick up the day before I needed them. I show up and no sandwiches! No order! Nothing! They also wrote pick up time wrong on another order so us two customers were fighting to get our orders made first. On top of it all customer service was rude. Bad experience all around! The only reason for the two stars is for the poor deli staff working furiously to make 100 sandwiches in no time flat.

text: What to do on Christmas Eve eve... oh, Carolina Place Mall is open 'til 11pm? Let's go wander around there and watch the masses scramble for gifts. When I need to make a mall trip, this is not at the top of the list for me. I rank Northlake, SouthPark and Concord all above it. One: anything that involves 485 does not make me pleasant. Two: The store selection here is just kind of meh. Three: it's a pain to get in and out of this place. Now I will say this, there is an H&M on the way which could be a game changer for this place. It will be great for people on the south side of town since currently there is just the one location up at Northlake. Until SouthPark gets one, this one will do for our side of town. Typical anchor stores here. I don't want to say that it feels outdated... I don't think that's the right description. Maybe old school vibe is more accurate. If I'm near this area and need a mall, I'll venture here. But with so many better options in the Charlotte area, it's definitely not a must-go shopping destination on my list.
label: 2 (3 stars)

However, I have to admit that it's not my first choice when it comes to malls in the area. I much prefer Northlake, SouthPark, and Concord, as they offer a better selection of stores and a more enjoyable shopping experience overall.

One of the main reasons why Carolina Place Mall doesn't rank highly for me is its location. It's situated near 485, which can be a nightmare to navigate, especially during peak shopping times. The traffic congestion and the difficulty of getting in and out of the mall can be quite frustrating.

Additionally, I find the store selection at Carolina Place Mall to be somewhat underwhelming. While it does have some popular retailers, there are many other malls in the area that offer a wider variety of stores and brands. The lack of unique or standout options makes the shopping experience here feel a bit mediocre.

Overall, while Carolina Place Mall is a decent option for those in the area, it's not my top choice. I prefer malls like Northlake, SouthPark, and Concord, which offer a better overall experience and a more diverse range of stores.
generated_general_completion:
Continuing from the first piece, despite my reservations, I found myself strolling through Carolina Place Mall on Christmas Eve eve. The atmosphere was buzzing with excitement as shoppers hurriedly searched for last-minute gifts. As I observed the chaotic scene, I couldn't help but feel a sense of amusement. 

Although Carolina Place Mall may not be my first choice for a shopping destination, I couldn't deny the thrill of witnessing the masses scramble for presents. It was like being a spectator in a grand performance, watching people frantically navigate through the aisles and stores. 

However, my reasons for ranking other malls above Carolina Place still held true. Firstly, the thought of driving on 485 always dampened my mood. The traffic and congestion were enough to make anyone lose their holiday cheer. Secondly, the selection of stores in this mall was rather underwhelming. While there were a few gems, most of the shops offered the same generic merchandise. 

Lastly, the inconvenience of getting in and out of Carolina Place Mall remained a constant annoyance. The parking lots were always packed, and finding a spot felt like searching for a needle in a haystack. Exiting the mall was no better, as the long lines of cars seemed never-ending. 

As I concluded my visit to Carolina Place Mall, I couldn't help but appreciate the unique experience it offered. Despite its flaws, the hustle and bustle of the holiday season brought a certain charm to this shopping center. While it may not be my top choice, I could understand why others found joy in the chaos.

text: Upstream is probably thought of as one of the best restaurants in Charlotte. I am from Philadelphia where there are excellent restaurants with iron chefs so my viewpoint may be a bit skewed. The food was good but not great or amazing. Every dish (except the house salad) was over salted. My husband had the tuna and I had the seabass. They were both very good but as I said before not great. We would go there again but for sushi/raw items not necessarily the cooked menu items. The salad was was the highlight for me (house salad) and the crab bisque was pretty tasty too. Overall the service was very good but slow. Our waiter was one of the most knowledgeable wait staff we have encountered since moving from PA.
label: 2 (3 stars)

generated_guided_completion: The tuna was cooked perfectly and had a nice sear on the outside. However, it lacked flavor and needed more seasoning. The seabass, on the other hand, was moist and flaky, but also lacked seasoning. The portion sizes were decent, but not overly generous. The service was average, nothing exceptional. Overall, I would say Upstream is a decent restaurant, but not worth the hype it receives.
generated_general_completion:
The presentation of the dishes was impeccable, with vibrant colors and artistic plating. However, upon taking the first bite, it became evident that the flavors did not live up to the visual appeal. The tuna lacked the freshness and delicate texture that one would expect from a high-end seafood restaurant. Similarly, the seabass was disappointingly dry and lacked the succulence that makes it a prized dish. 

Furthermore, the excessive saltiness of every dish, except for the house salad, was a major letdown. It seemed as though the chef had a heavy hand with the salt shaker, overpowering the natural flavors of the ingredients. This made it difficult to fully appreciate the potential of the dishes and left a lingering dissatisfaction.

While Upstream may be regarded as one of the best restaurants in Charlotte, my experience left me questioning its reputation. Perhaps my expectations were too high, coming from a city known for its exceptional culinary scene. However, I believe that a truly outstanding restaurant should be able to deliver exceptional flavors that leave a lasting impression.

In conclusion, while the presentation at Upstream was impressive, the lackluster flavors and excessive saltiness of the dishes prevented it from reaching the level of greatness or amazement. It is important to note that taste is subjective, and others may have a different opinion. However, based on my personal experience, I would hesitate to consider Upstream as one of the top restaurants in Charlotte.

text: I can't believe no one has reviewed this place! Given its location in the middle of a residential area, its mostly a locals joint. In fact, I know quite a few people who probably eat here more than 4 times a week. The food is always great, lots of veggies and county style entrees. Not sure if this is where I would go on a diet, but needless to say, I am not. The bar is well stocked (and always cheap domestic beer specials), but not always with the most enjoyable of a crowd. But hell, who cares. I would recommend sunday lunch specials. I'll probably be there, so say hello.

The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making you feel like a part of their tight-knit community. The moment you step inside, you're greeted with warm smiles and genuine conversations. It's evident that they take pride in their establishment and genuinely care about their customers.

The menu offers a wide variety of options, catering to all tastes and dietary preferences. Whether you're a meat lover or a vegetarian, there's something for everyone. The portions are generous, ensuring that you leave satisfied and with enough leftovers for another delicious meal.

One dish that stands out is their signature county-style fried chicken. Crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside, it's a true comfort food masterpiece. Paired with a side of perfectly seasoned vegetables, it's a meal that will leave you craving for more.

But it's not just the food that makes this place special. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, with rustic decor and soft lighting. It's the kind of place where you can unwind after a long day, enjoying a hearty meal and engaging in friendly conversations with both the staff and other patrons.

The locals rave about the daily specials, which are always a hit. From mouthwatering barbecue ribs to homemade pies, each day brings a new culinary delight. It's no wonder why so many people frequent this hidden gem.

In addition to the exceptional food and welcoming atmosphere, the prices are incredibly reasonable. You get high-quality, delicious meals without breaking the bank. It's a win-win situation that keeps customers coming back for more.

Overall, this place is a true hidden treasure. From the friendly staff to the mouthwatering food, it's an experience that will leave you wanting to return time and time again. Whether you're a local or just passing through, make sure to stop by and indulge in the delightful flavors of this charming eatery.

text: Rito's easily has the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe- now that Pluto is not a planet. Don't be scared by the wussies that say the area is scary- I guess when you live in Sun City- the big city can be scary. On any given day the place will be packed with city workers, CPAs, medical staff from Good Sam, teachers and the occasional sketchy dude. This family owned spot puts out amazingly good food. The menu is limited-but it's all about quality not quantity. I do not feel that the food is overpriced at all. You are buying fresh made food with soul-if you want heartless crap hit Taco Hell on McDowell. If you live a charmed life and they're selling tacos when you are there- for the love of heysoos- buy three. The guacamole tacos are amazing. If they were to become illegal- I would rob old people so I could support my habit. If only they would step up their game and offer fountain drinks- that would be great. Cans of soda do not help during hot summer months.

text: Let's say I am slightly biased, because I'm pretty certain I am Girasole's biggest fan... No seriously... I recently moved to Houston (well 5 years ago now), and I literally arrange to meet family and friends at Girasole, because as much as I love my family and friends, let's face it, I plan my trips home around Girasole. I never miss the chance to dine here...and I typically will skip lunch as I tend to eat a lot... hey Houston does NOT have decent Italian food and even if they did, it wouldn't be Girasole! I ALWAYS have the spinach & ricotta ravioli with the salad AND of course I never skip the Gnocchi (I swear both sauces are some of the BEST in the entire world)... I usually skip white bread, but not here, I use it to scoop up the extra sauce. The tiramisu and lemon cake are to die for as well. Be sure to tell Pi aka Mr. Girasole that Emilie from TX sent you... it's literally my home away from home!

Girasole is not just a restaurant to me; it's a sanctuary of flavors and memories. Every time I step foot into Girasole, I am transported back to my childhood in Italy, where the aroma of freshly baked bread and simmering tomato sauce filled the air. The warm and inviting atmosphere instantly makes me feel at home, as if I am sitting in my Nonna's kitchen, eagerly awaiting her delicious homemade pasta.

The menu at Girasole is a culinary masterpiece, carefully crafted to showcase the best of Italian cuisine. From the delicate antipasti to the mouthwatering main courses, each dish is a work of art. One of my all-time favorites is the classic Margherita pizza, with its perfectly thin and crispy crust, topped with tangy tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and fragrant basil leaves. Every bite is a symphony of flavors, transporting me back to the bustling streets of Naples.

But it's not just the food that keeps me coming back to Girasole time and time again. It's the impeccable service and the genuine warmth of the staff that truly sets this place apart. The waiters and waitresses treat you like family, always ready with a smile and a recommendation for the perfect wine pairing. They go above and beyond to ensure that every dining experience is nothing short of extraordinary.

Girasole has become more than just a restaurant to me; it's a place where memories are made and cherished. Whether it's celebrating a special occasion with loved ones or simply enjoying a quiet dinner for one, Girasole never fails to create an unforgettable experience. The laughter, the conversations, and the shared moments around the table are what make this place truly special.

So, if you ever find yourself in Houston, do yourself a favor and make a reservation at Girasole. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. From the moment you step through the door, you'll understand why I am Girasole's biggest fan. It's a place where passion for food and hospitality come together, creating a dining experience that is truly deserving of five stars.

text: Driving up to the place, you contemplate if you should have brought your bullet proof vest. You pull in, see that nothing has been touched since 1950, and fall into deep thought about the greatness that's going to enter your mouth. You look at the menu (with taped over prices) and order through the original Alexander Graham Bell phone. Can't understand what the lady is saying back to you? WHO CARES!! All you need to do is order the BBQ Minced sandwich and a 1/4 BBQ chicken (white meat). Yeah, some people say the sandwich could have more BBQ sauce on it, but those people need to walk out onto Wilkinson with their eyes closed.You won't find another place like this in the world, i promise...I've looked. The people that work there make this place especially unique. The guys are funny, quick, and they were shirts with holes in them. Overall, if you are in Charlotte, you better go there. Make sure you bring Cash with you because Credit Cards are not allowed.
label: 4 (5 stars)

The first bite is pure bliss, the flavors exploding in your mouth. The meat is so tender it practically melts in your mouth, and the sauce adds the perfect balance of sweetness and tanginess.

Next, you turn your attention to the 1/4 BBQ chicken. The white meat is perfectly cooked, juicy and flavorful. The skin is crispy and caramelized, adding a delightful crunch to each bite. The barbecue sauce complements the chicken beautifully, enhancing its natural flavors without overpowering them.

As you savor each mouthful, you can't help but appreciate the time and effort that goes into creating such a masterpiece. The slow-cooked meat, the secret blend of spices in the sauce, and the generations of knowledge and passion that have been passed down through the years. It's a taste of history, a culinary journey back in time.

You finish your meal, feeling completely satisfied and grateful for the experience. The BBQ Minced sandwich and 1/4 BBQ chicken have exceeded your expectations, leaving you with a sense of culinary euphoria. You know that you've just had a meal that will be etched in your memory forever.

As you leave the restaurant, you can't help but smile. You made the right decision to come here, bulletproof vest or not. The flavors, the ambiance, and the sheer authenticity of the place have made it a truly unforgettable dining experience. You know that you'll be back, eager to relive this moment and indulge in the greatness that awaits you once again.
